thread.title: Viemed Healthcare Announces Record Financial Results for First Quarter 2018

author: cnbc.com
title: Viemed Healthcare Announces Record Financial Results for First Quarter 2018

organizations.name: viemed healthcare announces record financial results

text:
LAFAYETTE, La., Viemed Healthcare, Inc. (the “ Company ” or “ Viemed ”) (TSXV:VMD), a home medical equipment supplier that provides post-acute respiratory care services in the United States, announced today that its financial statements for the three months ended March 31, 2018 and accompanying Management's Discussion & Analysis (MD&A) have been filed on SEDAR and are available at www.sedar.com .
Highlights are as follows (all dollar amounts are USD):
Revenues for the quarter ended March 31, 2018 were approximately $14.1 million and gross margin was $10.6 million, or 75%. Revenues and gross margin increased 41% and 45%, respectively as compared to the quarter ended March 31, 2017.
The Company had a working capital balance of $5.2 million as of March 31, 2018 and total long-term debt of $1.3 million. This, along with the $5 million unused line of credit, provides a stable liquidity profile for the Company.
The Company grew its ventilator patient count by approximately 38% as compared to prior year first quarter and 7% over fourth quarter 2017.
Capital expenditures totaled $2.9 million during the quarter to support the aforementioned organic growth.
Adjusted EBITDA for the quarter totaled approximately $3.8 million or 27%.
The Company expects to generate total revenues of approximately $14.8 - $15.3 million during the second quarter of 2018 and expects similar margins as the quarter
Subsequent to quarter end, the Company completed the ongoing CMS audit and is receiving cash payments that have been delayed for the last two quarters.
“We are very pleased with our first quarter results and our continuing trend of servicing a record amount of patients with our world class clinical protocols,” said Casey Hoyt, Viemed CEO. “Our patient centric Company culture of always putting the patients’ needs first should lead to continuing organic growth, and this growth will ultimately lead to our Company continuing to post records in both the top and bottom lines.”
Conference Call information
The details of the conference call are: Tuesday, May 8, 2018 at 11:00 a.m. Eastern time US & Canada Toll Free: Dial In: 1-800-239-9838 Meeting ID Number: 5970283 ABOUT VIEMED HEALTHCARE, INC.
Viemed, through its indirect wholly-owned subsidiaries Sleep Management, L.L.C. and Home Sleep Delivered, L.L.C., is a home medical equipment supplier that provides post-acute respiratory care services in the United States. Sleep Management, L.L.C. focuses on disease management and improving the quality of life for respiratory patients through clinical excellence, education, and technology. Its service offerings are based on effective home treatment with respiratory care practitioners providing therapy and counseling to patients in their homes using cutting edge technology. Home Sleep Delivered focuses on providing in-home sleep testing for sleep apnea sufferers. Visit our website at www.viemed.com .

Non-GAAP Measures
This press release refers to “EBITDA” which is a non-GAAP and non-IFRS financial measure that does not have a standardized meaning prescribed by GAAP or IFRS. The Company's presentation of this financial measure may not be comparable to similarly titled measures used by other companies. This financial measure is intended to provide additional information to investors concerning the Company's performance. EBITDA is defined as earnings before interest, tax, depreciation and amortization and is a measure of a company's operating performance. Essentially, it's a way to evaluate a company's performance without having to factor in financing decisions, accounting decisions or tax environments. The following table shows the Company’s Non-IFRS measure (EBITDA) reconciled to net income for the indicated periods:
Gross $USD % Net Income % $ 2,341,000 17 % Adjustments % (Income Tax, Depreciation, Interest, and Stock Compensation) $ 1,421,000 10 % Adjusted EBITDA % $ 3,762,000 27 % Management uses this non-GAAP measure as a key metric in the evaluation of the Company's performance and the consolidated financial results. The Company believes EBITDA is useful to investors in their assessment of the operating performance and the valuation of the Company. In addition, this non-GAAP measure addresses questions the Company routinely receives from analysts and investors and, in order to assure that all investors have access to similar data, the Company has determined that it is appropriate to make this data available to all investors. However, non-GAAP financial measures are not prepared in accordance with GAAP, and the information is not necessarily comparable to other companies and should be considered as a supplement to, not a substitute for, or superior to, the corresponding measures calculated in accordance with GAAP.
